smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class GameListPresenterTest is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onCreate appears to be too complex.
The function fullNameForJLeagueRanking appears to be too complex.
The function fullNameForFootbellGeist appears to be too complex.
The function yahooNewsUrl appears to be too complex.
The function onBindViewHolder appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function onCreate is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'GameListPresenter' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Interface 'GameListView' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'
Class 'GameListActivity' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface GameListView is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function whenParsingTestDataFirstIsKashima is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: ThrowingExceptionsWithoutMessageOrCause
smells.description: A call to the default constructor of an exception was detected. Instead one of the constructor overloads should be called. This allows to provide more meaningful exceptions.

instances.message: A call to the default constructor of an exception was detected. Instead one of the constructor overloads should be called. This allows to provide more meaningful exceptions.

smells.name: PrintStackTrace
smells.description: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

instances.message: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.
Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

smells.name: PackageNaming
smells.description: Package names should match the naming convention set in the configuration.

instances.message: Package name should match the pattern: ^[a-z]+(\.[a-z][a-z0-9]*)*$
Package name should match the pattern: ^[a-z]+(\.[a-z][a-z0-9]*)*$
Package name should match the pattern: ^[a-z]+(\.[a-z][a-z0-9]*)*$

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.
Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Private variable names should match the pattern: (_)?[a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Private variable names should match the pattern: (_)?[a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

instances.message: The file name 'Scopes.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'ActivityScope'.

smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Game defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
